p: In mid-2012, MERS emerged in Saudi Arabia due to human exposure to MERS-CoV-infected dromedary camels [ 9]. Further human-to-human transmission spread it to 27 countries across the globe [ [10], [11], [12], [13], [14], [15], [16]] with a total of 2519 laboratory-confirmed cases globally and a case-fatality rate of 34.3% until January 2020 [ 17]. Measures to control and prevent MERS involved aggressive contact tracing, quarantine, and isolation of the cases [ 18, 19].
